headline: How Investors May Respond To Coca-Cola (KO) CEO Transition, Restructuring, and Atlanta Layoffs
summary: Coca-Cola recently announced a leadership transition, with CEO James Quincey handing the role to Henrique Braun, alongside a 2026 restructuring that begins with about 75 layoffs at its Atlanta headquarters and is expected to roll out in phases. This combination of executive change, workforce reductions, and planned investment in areas like AI signals a meaningful shift in how Coca-Cola intends to run and grow its global beverage business. Next, we’ll examine how the CEO transition and...
